channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping, 12th November
item.description:
In the empty grounds of 'the laurels' there's a load of rubbish been dumped. Mattress, paint pots and other.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cambridge Road, Plaistow, London

item.title: Dead fox in rd towards Crayford, 12th November
item.description:
Traffic is swerving to avoid deceased fox

item.title: Pothole in middle of road on crossing point, 12th November
item.description:
A pothole had formed in middle of the road that can cause a hazard to vehicles and pedestrians using the designated crossing. Has been slowly getting worse but seems have taken a turn the past few days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Finchley Road, South Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Safety barrier smashed, 12th November
item.description:
Vehicle has crashed into safety barrier, yet again, and has removed footing causing damage to footpath.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gerda Road, Eltham

item.title: Rubbish left out by local residents all week, 12th November
item.description:
Against local regulations but council action to deal with this has been woefully inadequate - this encourages the constant fly tipping we see in the area

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Smalley Road Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Explosive fly tipping, 12th November
item.description:
I think it’s clear from the photo. Ever since the textile bin was put in people have been using the spot for dumping rubbish of all sorts.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Black Prince Road, Lambeth, London

item.title: Missing no entry sign, 12th November
item.description:
--- Issue type: Missing traffic sign Location: Endell Street, WC2 (near the junction where only one “No Entry” sign remains on the right-hand side) Description: The left-hand “No Entry” sign that used to be mounted on the lamppost is missing. Only the right-side sign remains, making the restriction unclear to approaching drivers, especially at night. Please could the missing sign be replaced or reinstated to ensure the restriction is properly marked and visible from both sides. Photo attached for reference.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Shelton Street, Bloomsbury, Camden Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Someone keeps on dumping rubbish here, 12th November
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Leadale Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dogs Fowling, 12th November
item.description:
I have seen on a regular basis owners of dogs allowing them to foul on Brookhill Road and not picking up the poo but when dog is finished the owner happily walks off to continue with their walk the dog walk. It's becoming a trend and it's shocking to see dog owners using Brookhill Road as a toilet. There needs to be signs that this is unacceptable on Brookhill Road.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brookhill Road, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet
